content.raw:
No, this package.xml is meant for anyone who wants to continue building gazebo from source and using it with ROS ( a large community :))

This includes, but is not limited to:

* people not on ubuntu (fedora, arch, suse, etc)
* people without root access to their machines
* people who want to be able to work with multiple workspaces with different versions of software without having to uninstall and reinstall them when switching between different demos or projects

The dependencies listed as "TODO" here are not really necessary, but could be used to optionally take advantage of systems like rosdep.
content.html:
No, this package.xml is meant for anyone who wants to continue building gazebo from source and using it with ROS ( a large community :))

This includes, but is not limited to:

  • people not on ubuntu (fedora, arch, suse, etc)
  • people without root access to their machines
  • people who want to be able to work with multiple workspaces with different versions of software without having to uninstall and reinstall them when switching between different demos or projects

The dependencies listed as "TODO" here are not really necessary, but could be used to optionally take advantage of systems like rosdep.
